Analyzes the strength of the case against him and questions its validity, demonstrating intelligence and situational awareness.
Refuses to betray family or associates despite pressure from Richie.
Dismisses accusations and denies connections to criminals who want to testify against him.
Expresses frustration but seeks a way to work things out with Richie.
Shows reluctance and moral conflict about cooperating with law enforcement.
Refuses to believe weak or indirect evidence against him, showing skepticism and critical thinking.
Expresses frustration and inability to find a solution to the problem posed by Richie, indicating some uncertainty or hesitation.
Considers options and acknowledges what he 'has to do' despite reluctance, showing awareness and strategic thinking.
Expresses disdain for corrupt cops who take his money, showing a sense of loyalty and moral boundary even within crime.
Debates internally about cooperating with Richie, showing hesitation and concern about consequences.
Refuses to lie or betray others easily, indicating a personal code of honor despite criminal activity.
Considers cooperating with Richie despite the risks, showing awareness of the consequences and weighing his options carefully.
Expresses strong emotions about corruption and betrayal, indicating clear priorities and values.
Hesitates and debates internally before making a decision, showing thoughtful deliberation.
Acknowledges the difficulty of naming everyone involved, implying the complexity of his network and the challenge ahead.
Puts up photographs of corrupt detectives in jail cell, symbolically exposing corruption.
Waits calmly with his belongings in prison cell, showing acceptance of consequences.
Creates and maintains a detailed 'Table of Organization' exposing corrupt cops, demonstrating strategic planning and intelligence.
Uses surveillance photographs effectively to build a case against corrupt law enforcement, showing skillful manipulation of evidence.
Waits calmly in prison with his belongings, showing acceptance and composure but no active resistance or escape attempt.
Looks around the changed neighborhood with a sense of loss and nostalgia, reflecting on past relationships and simpler times.
Engages in casual conversation with Richie, showing openness and a degree of friendliness.
Steps out of prison owning nothing but a cardboard box, looks around thoughtfully at changes in his old neighborhood, showing awareness and reflection.
Questions changes in his environment with a mix of confusion and nostalgia, indicating some disconnection from current realities.
Thanks Richie for the clothes he bought him off the street.
Refuses to make a phone call that would get him back in business, despite temptation.
Shows quiet menace to young gangsters, forcing them to back down without violence.
Expresses bitterness and distance from his brothers, saying he hasn't talked to them in years and it's better that way.
Considers making a phone call to get back in business but resists, showing self-control and awareness of consequences.
Expresses uncertainty about his future and doubts his own skills ('What do I know how to do? How am I going to live?').
Confronts approaching gangsters without moving, using quiet menace to deter conflict.
Defuses a tense situation by dismissing a potential conflict with a calm remark and walking away.
Uses quiet menace to defuse a potentially violent confrontation without escalating it.
Dismisses the gangsta's challenge with a confident, dismissive remark and walks away calmly.
